meanings.sent1: I ascribe my success to hard work and determination.
meanings.sent2: Many people ascribe the change in weather to global warming.
meanings.sent3: Some may ascribe my good luck to a lucky charm I carry.
meanings.sent4: She ascribed her artistic talent to her grandmother's influence.
meanings.sent5: The ancient Greeks would often ascribe natural phenomena to the will of the gods.

meanings.definition: Regard something as being due to (a specified cause).
meanings.sent1: He ascribes his good health to regular exercise and a balanced diet.
meanings.sent2: Some cultures ascribe certain events to supernatural forces.
meanings.sent3: I jokingly ascribe my love for chocolate to a chocolate-loving gene.
meanings.sent4: The author ascribed the character's flaws to his troubled childhood.
meanings.sent5: In folklore, people often ascribe mysterious happenings to ghosts and spirits.

meanings.definition: Assign a quality or value to.
meanings.sent1: The teacher ascribed a grade to each student's essay.
meanings.sent2: Some cultures ascribe symbolic meanings to colors.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing to ascribe human emotions to pets.
meanings.sent4: She ascribed great importance to the old family heirloom.
meanings.sent5: In literature, authors often ascribe bravery to their protagonists.
